# Support & Contact Policy

Thank you for using this project!  
This document explains what support options are available and how to get help effectively.

---

## ğŸ“Œ Scope of Support

We aim to provide transparent and respectful guidance on:

âœ… Installation & setup issues  
âœ… Reported bugs  
âœ… Feature requests & roadmap clarification  
âœ… Documentation corrections & improvements  
âœ… Responsible security reporting

Support is provided **on a best-effort basis** by the maintainers and community.

Commercial support is not currently provided â€” but may be available in the future.

---

## ğŸ†˜ Where to Get Help

| Need | Channel | Notes |
|---|---|---|
Report a bug | GitHub Issues | Include logs & steps to reproduce |
Request feature | GitHub Issues | Follow feature template |
Ask a question / ideas | GitHub Discussions (if enabled) | General help & feedback |
Docs / usage problem | README / Wiki / Examples | Confirm before filing issue |
Security concern | security@<your-domain> | **Do not open public issues** |
Urgent vulnerability | security@<your-domain> | Prioritized response |

---

## ğŸ“® Contact Rules

Please **do not** use personal email, social media, or DM maintainers for support.

All support requests must go through official channels above.

Security reports follow **responsible disclosure** via  
ğŸ“§ security@<your-domain>  
(see `SECURITY.md`).

---

## ğŸ“‚ Before Opening an Issue

Please ensure you have:

1. Read the README and documentation
2. Searched existing issues & PRs
3. Checked the changelog and release notes
4. Reproduced the issue using the latest version
5. Collected logs and minimal reproducible example (MRE)

---

## âš™ï¸ Diagnostic Checklist

If reporting a bug, include:

- OS & Python version
- Tool version (`--version`)
- Install method (pip, uv, poetry, system package, etc.)
- Steps to reproduce
- Expected vs actual behavior
- Relevant logs / screenshots / tracebacks

Example command to gather env info:

python -V && pip list

> These are goals, not guarantees â€” this is a community-driven project.

## ğŸ§ª Unsupported & Out of Scope

The following will **not** receive support:

âŒ Problems on unsupported Python versions  
âŒ Custom forks / third-party patches  
âŒ Commercial consulting / integration requests  
âŒ Debugging user apps or infrastructure  
âŒ Requests that bypass security reporting process  
âŒ Usage of modified, unpublished, or unreleased builds
